results.title: Ronin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Frank Mancuso, FGM Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Told proficiently, “Ronin” is an action/thriller about a group of renegade criminals for hire, a gang of international professional thieves and killers, without allegiances to country or cause. Deirdre, a mysterious Irish woman, organises a crack team for one high-risk job - to steal a valuable case of unknown contents. The team consists of an ex-CIA officer, a former European intelligence officer, a skilled driver, a top electronics expert and a weapons specialist. The five don’t know, like or particularly trust one another but must work together to get the job done. Director Frankenheimer, somewhat of an expert in the field of car chase sequences, flexes his knowledge here with spectacular rides through the narrow streets of Paris and Cannes. Pyrotechnics, rolling cars, shootouts and a minor love interest make “Ronin” a fairly standard crime movie with some very impressive stunts. International cast includes: Robert De Niro, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard, Jonathon Pryce and Jean Reno. Script is by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, Hannibal, State and Main) working under the pseudonym Richard Weisz.

results.title: Zoolander [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ben Stiller, Scott Rudin, Stuart Cornfeld, VH1 Films, Paramount Pictures and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Ben Stiller directed, co-wrote and starred in this comedy, which spoofs the world of male models. The idea, which began as a Stiller skit in 1996, is teased into a feature length film. The story centres on Derek Zoolander (Stiller) - a famous male model, three-time winner of model of the year and creator of several iconic looks including Le Tigre and Blue steel. Derek’s reign is threatened by the rise of Hansel McDonald (Owen Wilson) a male model whose freewheeling attitude makes him hotter than the 90s flavoured Derek. The plot centres on rivalry between the two models and the assassination of the Malaysian Prime Minister, whose new anti-child labour laws threatens the lucrative fashion trade. “Zoolander” satirises modelling, beauty, the cult of celebrity, nightclubs, MTV and VH1 type of fashion awards. One of the sharpest sequences in the film is a ‘walk-off’ between the two models, judged by none other than David Bowie. Numerous film references are peppered throughout including - 2001: A Space odyssey, the X-Files, the Manchurian candidate and Trading places. Cast includes: Jerry Stiller, David Duchovny, Vince Vaughn, Christine Taylor and Will Ferrell, with cameos by Billy Zane, Wynona Ryder, Donald Trump, Christina Slater, Lenny Kravitz, Gwen Stefani and Donatella Versace.

results.title: South Park: bigger, longer & uncut [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Trey Parker, Matt Stone, Paramount Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The boys from the American cult television program South Park launched onto the big screen in 1999 with their first feature length film ‘Bigger Longer and Uncut’, a cleverly written musical film looking at censorship and the influence film and television has on child development. Created by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park follows the misadventures of friends Stan Marsh, Kyle Broflovski, Kenny McCormick and Eric Cartman in a small town called South Park in Colorado. Alien abductions, giant Barbra Streisand monsters and poor Kenny being killed episode after episode are just a few things the foul-mouthed boys have to deal with. When the boys see an R film starring Canadian icons ‘Terrance and Philip’, their parents become distressed at the language the boys are using. Rather than take responsibility for not supervising their children, the parents choose to blame Canada, and arrest Terrance and Philip, causing an USA v Canada war. With Terrance and Philip’s lives at stake, the boys create an underground children’s resistance, aptly named ‘La Resistance’ to free their Canadian idols before they are executed. The films subplot explores relationships, including Stan’s unusual relationship with classmate Wendy Testeburger, and her new found affection for a boy who is ‘political’. South Park character favourites Mr Garrison, Mr Mackey, Chef and Officer Barbrady also make appearance, as does Saddam Hussein, Satan and Winona Ryder. Parker and Stone’s clever soundtrack, spoofing a number of popular musicals including ‘Les Miserables’ and ‘The Sound of Music’ in addition to their own musical creations, earned them an Oscar nomination for Best Song (“Blame Canada’) in 2000. Features the voices of Isaac Hayes, Minnie Driver, Eric Idle and George Clooney. Warning: CONTAINS COARSE LANGUAGE.

results.title: Before night falls [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Julian Schnabel, Jon Kilik and Grandview Pictures
results.brief_description: Before night falls is Julian Schnabel’s second feature, his follow-up to “Basquiat”. The story of Cuban poet and writer Reinaldo Arenas, the screenplay is based on Arenas’ memoirs. The film opens with Arenas’ idyllic, if impoverished youth - brought up by his adoring mother and a dictatorial father who forbade his son’s poetry. A shift to the city exposes Arenas to urban influences and his teachers encourage his artistic expression. Openly gay and politically active, the adult Arenas finds himself persecuted by the Castro regime and his writing is smuggled to France in order to be published. Javier Bardem plays Arenas as a passionate, talented hedonist whose attempts to escape incarceration are both daring and foolhardy. The cinematography depicts Cuba as a magical and beautiful place, saturated in decaying splendour, which is crippled by corruption and state sanctioned police brutality. Schnabel employs an episodic structure to relay the key moments of Arenas’ life. Cuba - a place teeming with culture, food, love, sex and passion - is contrasted with Arenas’ ‘freedom’ in New York. Despite his liberation Arenas is depressed, living austerely and the scenes take on a bleached aesthetic, reflecting perhaps the writer’s longing for his rich homeland.

results.title: Man on the moon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito, Mutual Film Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey won accolades for his performance as real life comedian Andy Kaufman in this bio-pic directed by Milos Foreman (One who flew over the cuckoos nest, Amadeus, The People vs. Larry Flint). With a brand of humour bordering on the profane, Kaufman measured the success of routines by the degree of offence taken by the audience. The film plots Kaufman’s rise through the stand-up ranks, until he graduated to television roles, the most famous of which was on the US TV comedy show “Taxi”. Danny de Vito plays George Shapiro, Kaufman’s manager who identified him as a true talent (perhaps even a genius) where others saw him as an annoying imbecile. The film tracks Kaufman’s romance to Lynne Margulies (Courtney Love), the trials faced by increasing fame and his need to continuously push the boundaries of acceptable material. Kaufman would often perform routines under an alias unbeknownst to those around him, including other cast and crew members. Foreman avoids delving into the motivations or psychology behind Kaufman’s peculiar artistic expression, opting instead for detailed reproductions of Kaufman’s many routines and characterisations.

results.title: The Entity
results.creator_credit: Sidney J. Furie, Harold Schneider, Pelleport Investors and American Cinema Productions
results.brief_description: This horror/haunted house/poltergeist movie is based on a true story of a woman who was harassed by inexplicable forces. Carla Moran (Barbara Hershey) is a caring mother who lives with her children, when she is repeatedly and brutally raped by an unseen entity, and besieged by other inconceivable events that petrify her. Carla is increasingly isolated (even ridiculed) for her experiences, which rack her emotionally and physically. When she seeks professional help, a team of psychiatrists study Carla’s situation seeking to unravel the source of her terror. Some sceptics in the team believe it to be female hysteria even insanity, but one kindly doctor, Phil Schneidermann (Ron Silver) is convinced of her sincerity and is determined to aid her plight with science and a parapsychological approach. At times genuinely terrifying, this film is somewhat dated, particularly in the special effects department, but interestingly was released just a year before Spielberg’s hugely successful “Poltergeist”, with which it shares many major themes. Hershey puts in a fine performance as an imperilled woman whose ordinary (if bleak) life is put under siege by forces beyond her comprehension. Although the film takes a somewhat dissatisfying turn mid-way through, it remains an interesting example of a science versus spirit movie and should prove a boon to horror buffs.

results.title: Sexy beast
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Glazer, Jeremy Thomas, Kanzaman S A, Film Four International and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Gary (Ray Winstone) is a retired criminal, living in a luxurious Spanish villa with his ex-porn star wife and a couple of choice friends. The news of the impending arrival of Don (Ben Kingsley) - a former colleague of Don’s and a psychopath, puts the group on knife-edge. Don descends on the group like a hurricane - spewing foul language and oozing menace. His mission is to bring Gary back to London for a jewellery heist, masterminded by Teddy Bass (Ian MacShane). Gary’s refusal means little to Don as he cajoles, threatens, prods and manipulates Gary into taking the job. Don also works on intimidating the group, who are catatonic with fear and are on a helpless mission not to evoke Don’s anger. “Sexy beast” is a thriller/crime film that has a kinetic style that is at times reminiscent of Guy Ritchie. This film was Jonathon Glazer’s debut feature and Ben Kingsley was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor.

results.title: Wall Street
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Edward Pressman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Skinny neckties and double-breasted suits adorn Wall Street, which follows the path of Bud Fox (Charlie Sheen) into a milieu of corporate capitalism. He soon realises to stay in this new world with high-powered corporate espionage player Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas) he must break a few rules. Gekko represents one of three father figures for Fox, the other two being his real father and his boss at the broking firm, all of whom give him constant advice. However, Fox’s overwhelming desire for gold cufflinks and brick-like cellular phones steer him down the path of corruption and greed and he soon realises the price of the pursuit of overnight success. Director Oliver Stone captures the hectic hum of the commerce world and encapsulates the greed that is synonymous with the rise of capitalism in the 1980s. Michael Douglas received an Oscar for Best Actor at the 1987 Academy Awards for his role as Gekko.

results.title: When Brendan met Trudy
results.creator_credit: Kieron Walsh, Lynda Myles, BBC Film Unit, Collins Avenue and Dendy Films
results.brief_description: Roddy Doyle (The Van, The Snapper, The Commitments) wrote the screenplay for this romantic comedy, set in modern day Dublin. Brendan is a shy schoolteacher, with few friends and no sex life to speak of who is obsessed with old films. He imagines himself at the centre of all his favourite roles, from “The Quiet man” to Godard’s “Breathless”. One evening whilst drinking in a local pub Brendan meets Trudy - an outgoing, vivacious and bubbly blonde - his complete opposite. Despite a disastrous first date Brendan and Trudy form an unlikely romance. Trudy’s secretive nature about her line of work leads Brendan to believe she is some kind of criminal, perhaps even a violent one. Brendan’s attempts to introduce Trudy to his snobbish family are disastrous and the pair struggle to keep their romance aflame. Characters enact scenes from Brendan’s favourite films, replete with subtitles. Part of the appeal of this film is the litany of film references and clips lifted from old movie classics. Directed by Kieron J. Walsh and starring Flora Montgomery and Peter McDonald.

results.title: The Blue angel = Der Blaue engel (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Erich Pommer and Universum Film
results.brief_description: The Blue angel is the film that made an international star of German actress Marlene Dietrich. Directed by Josef von Sternberg (the first of their eight collaborations), “The Blue angel” is a tale of love, obsession and madness. Lola (Dietrich) is an exotic singer and dancer in a nightclub, enthralling men nightly with her erotic routines. A straight laced and humourless professor (Emil Jannings) at a local school attends the club one evening in the hope of catching some of his errant students there. Lola, who beguiles him with her charms, immediately ensnares the Professor. The unlikely two form a romantic entanglement despite Lola’s offhand manner towards him. What follows is a tragic story of an ill-begotten match. Dietrich made her name with this film with her inimitable style, establishing her signature tune - “Falling in love again”. The tone of the film reflects the depressed state that Germany was in at that time - still suffering the after effects of World War One reparations. Sternberg displays his flair for visual expressiveness and moody atmosphere that he would continue to nurture throughout his career.
